body.p: The Ensemble models are used to:

multiple_choice.choice: Improve the predictive power of single trees.
Prune the trees to avoid overfitting.

feedback.p: Correct: They are also used to extend or support other methods.
Incorrect: You do not typically use these methods for pruning.
Incorrect: Consider the Gini Index and Entropy as measures of impurity.

body.p: What is the major difference between bagging and boosting:

multiple_choice.choice: Bagging learns models independently and combines them. Boosting learns model sequentially and also combines them.
Boosting learns models independently and combines them. Bagging learns model sequentially and also combines them.
Bagging and Boosting learns models independently and combines them but only boosting combines them.

feedback.p: Correct: Both will combine models but one the techniques differ.
Incorrect: The techniques aligned with each method is wrong.
Incorrect: Bagging will learn models independently from each other but not Boosting.

body.p: Which statement is true about random forests:

multiple_choice.choice: A random forest will build multiple decision trees that are decorrelated.
A random forest can not be used to inform the process of eliminating or dropping features that are low importance
Random forest is used strictly for regression tasks to improve predictive power.

feedback.p: Correct: It is used for Classification and Regression tasks and assesses importance of features in the dataset.
Incorrect: RF is a useful method in determining feature importance.
Incorrect: It is used for both classification and regression tasks.
